page.title: 15SOCIAL SURVEY - POPULATION
page.content: THE CONTEMPORARY RURAL POPULATION MAY BE DESCRIBED AS SOCIALLY ADVANTAGED INSOFAR AS THERE ARE STRONG BONDS WHICH BIND THE COMMUNITIES AND PROVIDE A CERTAIN DEGREE OF STABILITY AND SECURITY,SO THAT THE COMMON MALAISE OF "STRESS" MAY BE MINIMISED WITHIN A CARING ENVIRONMENT. INHABITANTS OF THESE DORMITORY VILLAGES ARE MAINLY MIDDLE CLASS (WITH AN INCREASING TENDENCY TOWARDS UPPER MIDDLE CLASS - BECAUSE OF PROPERTY PRICES), WITH A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF ELDERLY WORKING CLASS - PARTICULARLY IN CHAPEL BRAMPTON WHERE OLD ESTATE WORKERS LIVE IN TIED PROPERTIES OWNED BY THE ALTHORP ESTATES. FEW YOUNG MARRIED COUPLES CAN AFFORD TO SETTLE IN THE AREA, SO THAT THE POPULATION IS LARGELY MIDDLE-AGED AND ELDERLY. THERE ARE MANY WHO ARE 80 YEARS OLD OR MORE.
